question:
SOME PEOPLE GET INTO DEBT BY BUYING THINGS THEY DO NOT NEED AND CANNOT AFFORD. 
WHAT ARE SOME REASONS FOR THIS BEHAVIOUR?
WHAT ACTION CAN BE TAKEN TO PREVENT PEOPLE FROM HAVING THIS PROBLEM?
text: Credit Card and Financing Companies provide  false hope to the people to live in more than the necessary world by providing  money on a credit basis or in advance. A few people purchase unaffordable and unnecessary items and get themselves into financial obligations. Peer pressure and status symbol are the key reasons behind this kind of behaviour. Although serious problems have arisen as a result of this, there are solutions.

One of the first reasons for buying things on credit is Peer pressure or an influential environment in which a person does without proper identification of his needs but as per others' choice. For example, kids go to  school and demand the same laptop that their friends have and parents have to buy them under pressure which leads to a stressful life. Additionally, status symbol is also one of the vital causes of these kinds of actions. A recent research paper found that iPhone 13 Pro are purchased by 70% of people in the United States not because of  usability but because of maintaining social status.

However, there are practical solutions for the aforementioned problems, one's needs to keep a watch on oneself and inculcate financial discipline into one's life so that individuals will not spend beyond their reach. Satisfaction can not be attained by buying the latest items rather it is inside of a person and he has to feel it from inside. Moreover, Government should also take some initiatives to make it difficult for people to buy expensive or unnecessary things by increasing their Credit Score. To illustrate this, people in Europe do not have the purchasing power to afford even a car so they have to commute by rail and leading to less pollution and providing stress-free lives to their people.

In conclusion, with the advancement of technology, people's needs and requirements will increase and the urge to become better and better will never be quenched, so self-control is the only way  to come out of this behaviour with some government measures.
